desc: This course examines several major theoretical perspectives on psychotherapy. Students review empirically supported treatments for specific clinical disorders, as well as "nonspecific" factors that affect the therapeutic process. Students explore ethical and legal challenges related to psychotherapy delivery, as well as multicultural and other diversity issues. Course format is primarily discussion-based. Offered annually. Prerequisites: junior or senior standing and PSYCH 230, plus PSYCH 244 or PSYCH 247.
name: Clinical/Counseling Psych
prerequisites: Prerequisites: junior or senior standing and PSYCH 230, plus PSYCH 244 or PSYCH 247.
